message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.DC, cs.CR, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with problems in data reconstruction, which is a topic that falls under information theory (cs.IT). The focus is on reconstruction from synchronization codes, which are a type of error-correcting codes, making it relevant to distributed systems (cs.DS) and data structures (cs.DS). The paper also introduces a formula for the maximum number of common supersequences shared by sequences at a certain edit distance, which is a combinatorial problem, making it relevant to discrete mathematics (cs.DM) and algorithms and data structures (cs.DS). The paper also considers extensions to other channels, such as adversarial deletion and insertion/deletion channels and probabilistic channels, which are relevant to cryptography (cs.CR) and machine learning (cs.LG).
